毀滅者，中立邪惡之劍，在其劍柄末梢鑲有一顆尖晶石。
你在使用這把劍進行的攻擊檢定和傷害骰上具有+3加值。此外，當你持握這把劍時，你可以使用你的反應以在任何位於你觸及範圍內的生物對你造成傷害時以這把劍對它進行一次近戰攻擊。你在該攻擊檢定中具有優勢，且任何這次特殊攻擊所造成的傷害都將無視目標擁有的任何傷害免疫或抗性。

item.name: Sword of Kas
entries: When Vecna grew in power, he appointed an evil and ruthless lieutenant, Kas the Bloody Handed, to act as his bodyguard and right hand. This despicable villain served as advisor, warlord, and assassin. His successes earned him Vecna's admiration and a reward: a sword with as dark a pedigree as the man who would wield it.

For a long time, Kas faithfully served the {@creature lich} but as Kas's power grew, so did his hubris. His sword urged him to supplant Vecna, so that they could rule the {@creature lich||lich's} empire in Vecna's stead. Legend says Vecna's destruction came at Kas's hand, but Vecna also wrought his rebellious lieutenant's doom, leaving only Kas's sword behind. The world was made brighter thereby.

The Sword of Kas is a magic, sentient longsword that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. It scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, and deals an extra {@dice 2d10} slashing damage to undead.

If the sword isn't bathed in blood within 1 minute of being drawn from its scabbard, its wielder must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the wielder takes {@dice 3d6} psychic damage. On a failed save, the wielder is dominated by the sword, as if by the {@spell 支配怪物} spell, and the sword demands that it be bathed in blood. The spell effect ends when the sword's demand is met.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The Sword of Kas has the following random properties:

items: 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial property}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial property}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental property}
1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental property}

entries.name: Spirit of Kas
entries: While the sword is on your person, you add a {@dice d10} to your initiative at the start of every combat. In addition, when you use an action to attack with the sword, you can transfer some or all of its attack bonus to your Armor Class instead. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While the sword is on your person, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells (save 18) from it: {@spell 召雷術}, {@spell 聖言術}, or {@spell 死亡一指}. Once you use the sword to cast a spell, you can't cast that spell again from it until the next dawn.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The Sword of Kas is a sentient chaotic evil weapon with an Intelligence of 15, a Wisdom of 13, and a Charisma of 16. It has hearing and {@sense 黑暗視覺} out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common

entries.name: Personality
entries: The sword's purpose is to bring ruin to Vecna. Killing Vecna's worshipers, destroying the {@creature lich||lich's} works, and foiling his machinations all help to fulfill this goal.
The Sword of Kas also seeks to destroy anyone corrupted by the Eye and {@item Hand of Vecna}. The sword's obsession with those artifacts eventually becomes a fixation for its wielder.

entries.name: Destroying the Sword
entries: A creature attuned to both the {@item Eye of Vecna} and the {@item Hand of Vecna} can use the wish property of those combined artifacts to unmake the Sword of Kas. The creature must cast the {@spell 祈願術} spell and make a Charisma check contested by the Charisma check of the sword. The sword must be within 30 feet of the creature, or the spell fails. If the sword wins the contest, nothing happens, and the {@spell 祈願術} spell is wasted. If the sword loses the contest, it is destroyed.

item.name: Sword of the Paruns
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, once on each of your turns, you can use one of the following properties if you're holding the sword:

items: Immediately after you use the {@action 攻擊} action to attack with the sword, you can enable one creature within 60 feet of you to use its reaction to make one weapon attack.
Immediately after you take the {@action 疾走} action, you can enable one creature within 60 feet of you to use its reaction to move up to its speed.
Immediately after you take the {@action 閃避} action, you can enable one creature within 60 feet of you to use its reaction to gain the benefits of the Dodge action.

item.name: Sword of Zariel
item.reqAttune: by a creature the sword deems worthy
entries: This longsword belonged to the angel Zariel before her fall from grace. Fashioned from celestial steel, it gives off a faint glow and hum. The weapon chooses who can attune to it and who can't. It desires a wielder who embodies bravery and heroism.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: The sword allows you to attune to it immediately, without having to take a short rest. The first time you attune to the sword, you are transformed into a heavenly, idealized version of yourself, blessed with otherworldly beauty and a touch of heaven in your heart. Neither magic nor divine intervention can reverse this transformation. Your alignment becomes lawful good, and you gain the following traits:

items.name: Angelic Language
items.entry: You can speak, read, and write Celestial.

items.name: Celestial Resistance
items.entry: You have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage.

items.name: Divine Presence
items.entry: Your Charisma score becomes 20, unless it is already 20 or higher.

items.name: Feathered Wings
items.entry: You sprout a beautiful pair of feathered wings that grant you a flying speed of 90 feet and the ability to hover. If you already have a different kind of wings, these new wings replace the old ones, which fall off.

items.name: Truesight
items.entry: Your eyes become luminous pools of silver. You can see in normal and magical darkness, see {@condition 隱形} creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic, and see into the Ethereal Plane, all within a range of 60 feet.

items.name: New Personality
entries: You gain new personality traits, determined by rolling once on each of the following tables. These traits override any conflicting personality trait, ideal, bond, or flaw.

entries.caption: Personality Traits
rows: I treat all beings, even enemies, with respect.
I won't tell a lie.
I enjoy sharing my philosophical worldview and experiences with others.
I cut right to the chase in every conversation.
I often quote (or misquote) religious texts.
I anger quickly when I witness cruelty or injustice.
My praise and trust are earned and never given freely.
I like everything clean and organized.

entries.caption: Ideals
rows: Charity. I always help those in need. (Good)
Faith. I choose to follow the tenets of a particular lawful good deity to the letter. (Lawful)
Responsibility. It is the duty of the strong to protect the weak. (Lawful)
Respect. All people deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)
Honor. The way I conduct myself determines my reward in the afterlife. (Lawful)
Redemption. All creatures are capable of change for the better. (Good)

entries.caption: Bonds
rows: I have a favorite religious hymn that I constantly hum.
I must keep a written record of my beliefs and the sins that I witness. When finished, this book will be my gift to the multiverse.
I have cherished memories of Idyllglen, though I've only seen this bucolic town in dreams.
I would die for those who fight beside me, regardless of their faults.
I seek to honor the angel Zariel by destroying fiends and other evildoers wherever I find them.
The Sword of Zariel has chosen me. I shall not fail to wield it justly.

entries.caption: Flaws
rows: I am too quick to judge others.
I offer forgiveness too readily.
I will sacrifice innocent lives for the greater good.
Flaw? What flaw? I am flawless. Utter perfection!
I allow nothing to stand in the way of my crusade to eradicate evil from the multiverse.
I ignore those who do not support my plans, for my calling is higher than all others.

entries.name: Holy Light
entries: The sword sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. Fiends find the sword's light disconcerting and painful, even if they can't see it, and have disadvantage on attack rolls made within the weapon's radius of bright light.
As a bonus action, you can intensify the sword's light, causing it to shed bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet, or reduce its glow to its normal intensity.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: The sword has 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial properties}.

entries.name: Searing Radiance
entries: The sword deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) radiant damage to any creature it hits, or 16 ({@dice 3d10}) radiant damage if you're wielding the weapon with two hands. An evil creature that takes this radiant damage must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition 目盲} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The Sword of Zariel is a sentient, lawful good item with an Intelligence of 10, a Wisdom of 20, and a Charisma of 18. It has hearing and normal vision out to a range of 30 feet.
The sword communicates by transmitting emotion to the creature carrying or wielding it.

entries.name: Truth Seer
entries: While holding the sword, you gain advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill 洞悉}) checks.

entries.name: Destroying the Sword
entries: Zariel can destroy the sword simply by grasping it. She couldn't bring herself to do so when she was an angel, but as an archdevil she has no compunction about ridding the multiverse of the weapon. The sword is also destroyed if it's used to shatter the Companion (see "{@adventure Shattering the Companion|bgdia|8|shattering the companion}"), unless the blade is wielded by an angel of challenge rating 15 or higher, or a good-aligned cleric or paladin of at least 10th level.
If Zariel is killed for good (that is, if she dies in the Nine Hells), the sword becomes no harder to destroy than a normal longsword.

item.name: 純善護符
item.reqAttune: by a creature of good alignment
entries: 這個護符是善良的強大象徵。一個既非善良也非邪惡陣營的生物會在觸碰這個護符時受到{@dice 6d6}光耀傷害。一個邪惡的生物則會在觸碰這個護符時受到{@dice 8d6}光耀傷害。這兩類生物在它們每次回合結束時若正持握或攜帶這個護符，則它們都將再次受到該傷害。
若你是一個善良的牧師或聖武士，則你可以使用這個護符作爲一個聖徽，且你在穿戴或持握它的期間在法術攻擊檢定中獲得+2加值。
這個護符含有7發充能。若你正穿戴或持握它，你可以使用一個動作以消耗1發充能，並選擇一個距離你120尺內，在地面上且你能看見的生物。若該生物屬於邪惡陣營，則一道烈焰裂隙將在它腳下打開。目標必須成功通過一次DC 20的敏捷豁免，否則將摔入裂隙中並被摧毀，屍骨無存。這道裂隙接着將不留痕跡的關閉。當你消耗最後一發充能時，這個護符將粉碎成金黃色的光點並被摧毀。

item.name: 法球護符
entries: 當你在持握這個護符時進行用以控制{@item 湮滅法球}的智力（{@skill 奧祕}）檢定時，你使你的熟練加值在該檢定中變爲兩倍。此外，當你在控制{@item 湮滅法球}期間開始你的回合，你可以使用一個動作使它飄移10尺加上等同於10x你的智力調整值尺數的距離。

item.name: 至惡護符
item.reqAttune: by a creature of evil alignment
entries: 這個物品象徵着不思悔悟的邪惡。一個既非善良也非邪惡陣營的生物會在觸碰這個護符時受到{@dice 6d6}黯蝕傷害。一個善良的生物則會在觸碰這個護符時受到{@dice 8d6}黯蝕傷害。這兩類生物在它們每次回合結束時若正持握或攜帶這個護符，則它們都將再次受到該傷害。
若你是一個邪惡的牧師或聖武士，則你可以使用這個護符作爲一個聖徽，且你在穿戴或持握它的期間在法術攻擊檢定中獲得+2加值。
這個護符含有6發充能。若你正穿戴或持握它，你可以使用一個動作以消耗1發充能，並選擇一個距離你120尺內，在地面上且你能看見的生物。若該生物屬於善良陣營，則一道烈焰裂隙將在它腳下打開。目標必須成功通過一次DC 20的敏捷豁免，否則將摔入裂隙中並被摧毀，屍骨無存。這道裂隙接着將不留痕跡的關閉。當你消耗最後一發充能時，這個護符將溶解成散發惡臭的黏液並被摧毀。

item.name: 說話玩偶
entries: 當這個填充玩偶距離你5尺內，你就可以花費一次短休的時間教導它說出最多六個短句，每個短句的長度都不能超過六個字，併爲分別設置玩偶說出各短句的情境條件。你也可以將舊的短句替換成新的。無論設置的情境條件爲何，它都必須發生在玩偶的5尺內纔會使這個玩偶開口說話。舉例來說，每當某人將這個玩偶撿起，它可能會開口說出：「我想要一些糖果。」當你終止與玩偶的同調時，這個玩偶所學會的短句也將全部遺失。

item.name: Tangler Grenade
entries: A tangler grenade is an alchemical, nonmagical item with an ovoid resin shell that shatters on impact. An as action, a creature can throw a tangler grenade at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of a shattered tangler grenade must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition 束縛} by sticky white webs. As an action, a creature can try to free itself or another creature within its reach from the webs, doing so with a successful DC 20 Strength ({@skill 運動}) check. A gallon of alcohol dissolves the webs produced by a single tangler grenade. Otherwise, the webs dissolve on their own after 1 hour, freeing any creatures {@condition 束縛} by them.

item.name: 啤酒杯
entries: 一個啤酒杯可以容納1品脫的液體。

item.name: Tankard of Plenty
entries: This golden stein is decorated with dancing dwarves and grain patterns. Speaking the command word ("Illefarn") while grasping the handle fills the tankard with three pints of rich dwarven ale. This power can be used up to three times per day.

item.name: 清醒啤酒杯
entries: 這個啤酒杯的其中一面刻着一張嚴厲的臉孔。你可以喝下倒進它內部的麥酒、葡萄酒、或任何其它非魔法的酒精飲料而不會醉。這個啤酒杯對於魔法液體或有害物質（例如毒藥）不會發揮任何效果。

item.name: Tantan
entries: A tambourine, a popular instrument with halflings and humans south of the Dalelands.

item.name: Taol
entries: Brass coin, about two inches square with a hold large enough for a {@item nib|wdh} to fit in (1 taol = 200 {@item nib|wdh|nibs})

item.name: Tearulai
entries: The longsword, Tearulai, is a sentient, neutral good {@item sword of sharpness} with an emerald-colored blade and precious gemstones embedded in its hilt and pommel. The sword's magical properties are suppressed until it is removed from Valdemar's skull.

Evil creatures can't attune to Tearulai; any evil creature that tries to do so takes 20 psychic damage. The weapon's emerald blade can't be damaged or dulled, and the sword can't be teleported anywhere without its wielder while the two are attuned to one another.

entries.name: Spells
entries: The sword has 6 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 2} expended charges daily at dawn. A creature attuned to the sword can use an action and expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells from it without material components: {@spell 飛行術} (2 charges), {@spell 變形術} (3 charges), or {@spell 植物遁走術} (4 charges).

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The sword has an Intelligence of 17, a Wisdom of 12, and a Charisma of 20. It has hearing and {@sense 真實視覺} out to a range of 120 feet. It communicates telepathically with its attuned wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common, Draconic, Elvish, and Sylvan. In addition, the sword can ascertain the true value of any gemstone brought within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Tearulai admires great beauty, music, fine art, and poetry. Vain, the weapon strives to improve its appearance. It craves gemstones and seeks out better ones with which to adorn itself. Most of all, it longs to return to the forests around Myth Drannor, where it was created. If its wielder's goals run counter to its own, Tearulai attempts to take control of its wielder and escape Undermountain, whereupon it can use its {@spell 植物遁走術} spell to return whence it came.
When you attack an object with this magic sword and hit, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target.

When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra 14 slashing damage. Then roll another {@dice d20}. If you roll a 20, you lop off one of the target's limbs, with the effect of such loss determined by the DM. If the creature has no limb to sever, you lop off a portion of its body instead.
{@i Note: According to the SRD, it is an extra {@dice 4d6} slashing damage, although {@link this is incorrect|https://rpg.stackexchange.com/a/174522/53884}}.

In addition, you can speak the sword's command to cause the blade to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Speaking the command word again or sheathing the sword puts out the light.

item.name: 達文-納之牙
entries: 達文-納之牙是多個故事的具現。它們是成套的牙齒，每一顆都代表着各自大不相同的起源，並且由多種多樣的材料製成。整套牙齒被收藏在一個小皮袋中，皮袋上縫着英雄和幻想生物的圖案。牙齒在哪裏落下，傳說就會在哪裏化爲真實。

entries.name: 使用牙齒
entries: 當持握小皮袋時，你可以使用一個動作從中取出某一顆牙齒。在達文-納之牙表格中擲骰以決定被取出的是哪顆牙齒，你可以選擇將其播種或者進行植牙。（這兩種行爲會在之後進行說明）
如果你不進行播種也不植牙，則在你的回合結束時投一個骰子。投出偶數時，牙齒會消失，對應的生物會如同你播種了牙齒一樣出現，並且與你和你的盟友敵對。投出奇數時，該牙齒會取代你的一顆牙齒，就如同你進行了植牙一樣（有可能取代另一顆被植入的牙齒，見下文）。
每顆牙齒只能被使用一次。記錄有哪些牙齒被使用了。如果在某顆牙齒已經被使用後再次投出對應的骰值，你會取出表格中位於最底下的未被使用的牙齒。

entries.caption: 達文-納之牙
rows: 烏爾敦達之貓在凝視The staring cats of Uldundar（象牙制貓臼齒）
9只 {@creature 貓}
此牙齒具有8發充能，你可以消耗1發充能以施展 {@spell 回生術} 。如果你死亡，牙齒會在你的回合開始時消耗1發充能以對你施展 {@spell 回生術}。
道格的驚奇一日Duggle's Surprising Day（人類臼齒）
1位 {@creature 平民}
完成長休後，牙齒對你施展 {@spell 庇護術} (DC 18) , 持續24小時或直至你打破該效應。
達坎的黃金時代The Golden Age of Dhakaan（金制地精前臼齒）
10位 {@creature 地精}, 1位 {@creature 地精頭目}
當你被攻擊命中並且你5尺內存在你的盟友時，你可以用你的反應使該攻擊改爲命中你的盟友。你不能再使用此反應，直至你完成一次短休或長休。
磨坊路謀殺案The Mill Road Murders（半身人犬齒）
3位組成集會的 {@creature 綠鬼婆}
當你對一個在戰鬥中尚未執行過自己回合的目標造成傷害時，目標額外受到來自鬼靈劍刃的 {@damage 3d10} 點揮砍傷害。
馬爾費吉的末日Dooms of the Malpheggi（翡翠蜥蜴人尖牙）
1位 {@creature 蜥蜴女王||蜥蜴人女王} 和 4位 {@creature 蜥蜴人}
你長出爬行動物的鱗片，使你的ac獲得+2加值。此外，每當你完成一次長休，你必須進行一次DC 15的體質豁免，豁免失敗則提升1級{@condition 力竭}.
馬伕的祕密The Stable Hand's Secret（甜味的人類犬齒）
2只 {@creature 夢魔}
當你對一個類人生物進行一次魅力檢定時，你可以使該檢定獲得 {@dice d10} 加值，該生物在第二天黎明起會變得與你敵對。
驢之夢The Donkey's Dream （彩虹色的驢臼齒）
1匹 {@creature 獨角獸}
此牙齒具有3發充能。作爲一個動作，你可以消耗一發充能並觸碰一個生物。該生物恢復 {@dice 2d8 + 2} 生命值，並且解除所有影響它的疾病和毒素。使用該動作時，你前額會出現一個閃閃發光的獨角獸之角幻象，持續至你的回合結束。你獲得以下缺陷："當我看見邪惡在行動時，我必須去對抗它。"
跨越布拉之巖Beyond the Rock of Bral（銀製奪心魔牙齒）
2只 {@creature 奪心魔}
你獲得120尺心靈感應，描述見怪物圖鑑。你可以隨意施展 {@spell 偵測思想} 法術，而無需任何法術成分。由於來自記憶和周圍的心靈的絮叨低語，你在感知 ({@skill 洞悉}) 和感知 ({@skill 察覺}) 檢定中獲得劣勢。
半幽魂的消失The Disappearances of Half Hollow（大蟾蜍的犁齒）
4只 {@creature 巨蟾蜍}
無論是否助跑，你都能跳至多30尺遠，15尺高。
魅影與幽魂的傳奇Legendry of Phantoms and Ghosts（黑曜石制人類臼齒）
1只 {@creature 巨章魚}, 1位 {@creature 魔法師}, 1只 {@creature 幽靈}
作爲一個動作，你可以用牙齒施展 {@spell 艾伐黑觸手} 法術 (DC 18)。該屬性被使用後，直至下個黎明前，不能再次使用。
詹德·陽星的永劫The Thousand Deaths of Jander Sunstar（泛黃的吸血鬼尖牙）
1位 {@creature 吸血鬼}
你可以進行啃咬攻擊，作爲一種徒手打擊。命中時，造成 {@damage 1d6} 穿刺傷害外加 {@damage 3d6} 黯蝕傷害。你恢復等同於所造成黯蝕傷害的生命值。當你處於陽光下時，你無法恢復生命值。
卡伽什的夢魘Nightmares of Kaggash（扭曲的眼魔牙齒）
1只 {@creature 眼魔}
作爲一個動作，你可以用牙齒施展 {@spell 攝心目光} 法術。使用該動作後，直到下次黎明前，不能再次使用該動作。當你完成一次長休時，骰一個 {@dice d20}。得出20時，一隻由DM選擇的異怪出現在你30尺內並開始攻擊。
通天三橋Three Bridges to the Sky（青金石制惡鬼尖牙）
3位 {@creature 惡鬼}
你獲得30尺飛行速度，並且你可以用牙齒隨意施展 {@spell 偵測魔法} 法術。當你同調的魔法物品數量少於三件時，你提升1級 {@condition 力竭} ，該狀態無法被移除，直至你同調至少三件魔法物品。
卓戈薩之爪The Claws of Dragotha（破碎的半透明尖牙）
1條 {@creature adult red dracolich|tce}
你可以用牙齒施展 {@spell 創造不死生物} 法術。該屬性被使用後，直到下次黎明前，不能再次使用。每當你用牙齒創造一隻不死生物時，一隻{@creature 骷髏}，{@creature 殭屍}或{@creature 食屍鬼}會同時出現在你5裏內一個隨機的位置，開始尋找並獵殺活物。被這些不死生物殺死的類人生物在下一個午夜被喚起爲同種類型的不死生物。
歲月之灰與永恆之火Ashes of the Ages and Eternal Fire（玉製類人前臼齒）
1只 {@creature 土巨靈(達奧)}, 1只 {@creature 氣巨靈(鎮尼)}, 1只 {@creature 火巨靈(伊夫利特)}, 1只 {@creature 水巨靈(瑪利德)}
你可以用牙齒施展9環的 {@spell 法術反制}法術。該屬性被使用後，直到下次黎明前，不能再次使用。每當你完成一次長休時，如果你從上一次長休結束直到現在都沒有用牙齒反制一個法術，你的最大生命值將減少 {@dice 2d10}。如果該效應將你的最大生命值降至0，你死亡。
拜爾之女Daughter of Bel（綠鋼製深淵煉魔尖牙）
1只 {@creature 深獄煉魔}
你可以用牙齒施展 {@spell 支配怪物} (DC 18)法術。該屬性被使用後，直到下次黎明前，不能再次使用。你聞起來有很重的硫磺味。
藍天爲何長嘯Why the Sky Screams（藍龍尖牙）
1條 {@creature 遠古藍龍}
你獲得閃電傷害的免疫以及雷鳴傷害的易傷。
最後的泰拉斯奎巨獸The Last Tarrasque（泰拉斯奎巨獸牙齒的鋸齒狀小片）
1頭 {@creature 泰拉斯奎巨獸} (無視你以及你的命令，在 {@dice 1d4} 輪後消失)
你對物件和建築造成雙倍傷害。如果你在一回合內受到至少20點傷害，你必須成功通過一個DC 18的感知豁免，否則將在你的下回合內陷入殘暴的憤怒中。處於這種憤怒中時，你必須儘可能地移動靠近傷害你的生物，並用你的動作對它進行一次徒手攻擊。如果你不是被生物所傷害，則選擇一個隨機的可見生物。
因森達克斯之牙Incendax's Tooth（紅寶石紋路的紅龍牙齒）
1條 {@creature 遠古紅龍}
你獲得火焰傷害的免疫。作爲一個動作，你可以噴出90尺錐形的火焰。在範圍的生物必須進行一次DC 24的敏捷豁免，豁免失敗者受到 {@damage 26d6} 點火焰傷害，成功則傷害減半。使用該吐息武器後，你提升2級 {@condition 力竭}.
達文-納之牙Dahlver-Nar's Tooth（蒙灰的人類臼齒）
1位 {@creature 祭司}
作爲一個動作，你可以呼喚神聖力量援助你。描述你需要的幫助，回應的結果由DM決定；此時通常請求任何牧師法術的效應都在可接受範圍內。該屬性被使用後，七天內不能再次使用。

entries.name: 播種牙齒
entries: 爲了播種牙齒，你將它放置在你觸及內一個未被佔據的空間的地面上，或者你可以將它或者你可以將它投擲到10尺內一處未被佔據的空間，使其落入一片至少50尺寬，50尺長的水體中。這樣做時，牙齒不留痕跡地鑽入地面，或者消失在水中。列在召喚的生物一欄中的生物將出現在儘可能靠近牙齒播種處的一個未被佔據的空間。該生物視你爲盟友，能說你所知的一切語言，並且在消失前存在10分鐘，除非另有說明。

entries.name: 植入牙齒
entries: 要植入牙齒，你將它放在你的口中，你自己的一顆牙齒將掉落，而被取出的牙齒將取代它的位置，這顆牙齒會調整大小來適應你的口腔。牙齒被植入後，你獲得寫在植牙效應一欄的效應。該牙齒在你和牙齒調諧時無法被移除，並且你無法自願解除和它們的調諧。如果牙齒在你死亡後被移除，該牙齒將消失。你最多可以植入牙齒的數量等同於1 + 你的體質調整值（至少可以植入兩顆牙齒）。如果你嘗試植入更多的牙齒，新植入的牙齒會取代一枚已經被植入的牙齒，隨機決定。被取代的牙齒將消失，你將失去它的植牙效應。

entries.name: 恢復牙齒
entries: 當所有牙齒都消失後，放置它們的小皮袋也會消失。小皮袋和全部的牙齒隨後將出現在一個隨機的位置，有可能是在物質位面內的另一個世界。

entries.name: 摧毀牙齒
entries: 每一顆牙齒必須分別摧毀，方法是懷着摧毀它的意圖，將它播種在該牙齒的故事發源的地方。當以這種方式被播種時，被召喚出的生物並不對你友好，也不會消失。一些被召喚出的生物僅僅會前去尋找一個棲息的地方，另一些則會像自己的傳說裏那樣行事。不管是哪種情況，該牙齒都會永遠消失。

item.name: Tej
entries: Tej is an amber-colored, fermented drink made from honey. It's more common and popular in Chult than beer or ale. A mug of tej costs 4 cp in Port Nyanzaru or 6 cp in Fort Beluarian. A 1-gallon cask costs 2 sp in the city or 3 sp at the fort.

item.name: Teleporter Ring
entries: As an action, a creature wearing a teleporter ring can activate the teleportation circle either in area K22 or area E1, teleporting itself and up to six other willing creatures from one circle to the other.

item.name: 觸手權杖
entries: 由{@creature 卓爾}製作，這把權杖是一把在末端有着三條軟韌觸手的魔法武器。當持握這把權杖時，你可以使用一個動作以引導這些觸手各自攻擊一個距離你15尺內且你所能看見的生物。每條觸手各自進行一次帶有+9命中加值的近戰攻擊檢定。若命中，該觸手將造成{@dice 1d6}鈍擊傷害。若你使用這三條觸手命中同一個目標，則它必須進行一次DC 15的體質豁免。若豁免失敗，該生物在接下來1分鐘內的速度將被減半，在敏捷豁免中具有劣勢，且無法使用它的反應。除此之外，在它的每個回合，它將只能使用一個動作或一個附贈動作，而不能在同一回合使用兩者。在它的每個回合結束時，它可以重複進行這個豁免檢定，豁免成功則結束這個效果對它的影響。

item.name: The Bloody End
entries: Carrying the power of Bane, this adamantine morningstar sports foot-long spikes and has a jagged blade on its pommel.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: The Bloody End is a sentient lawful evil weapon with an Intelligence of 22, a Wisdom of 18, and a Charisma of 24. It has hearing and {@sense 黑暗視覺} out to a range of 120 feet.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understand Common and Infernal.

entries.name: Personality
entries: A tyrannical {@creature pit fiend} named Izeelzee lives within The Bloody End. The weapon boisterously pushes its wielder to subjugate others and to never back down from a challenge. If the wielder doesn't demand fealty from others, the weapon is happy to demand it on their behalf.

entries.name: Dormant
entries: The morningstar grants the following benefits in its dormant state:

items: You can speak, read, and write Infernal.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

While holding the morningstar, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells from it (save DC 13): {@spell 魅惑人類}, {@spell 支配人類}, or {@spell 恐懼術}. Once a spell has been cast using the morningstar, that spell can't be cast from it again until the next dawn.
While holding the morningstar, you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill 威嚇}) checks.

entries.name: Awakened
entries: When the morningstar reaches an awakened state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +2.
The saving throw DC for spells cast from the morningstar increases to 15.

When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack using The Bloody End, you can cause the following effect: each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition 恐懼} of you until the end of your next turn. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.
When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal {@damage 1d6} psychic damage to the attacker.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: When the morningstar reaches an exalted state, it gains the following properties:

items: The weapon's bonus to attack and damage rolls increases to +3.
Add {@spell 支配怪物} to the list of spells that can be cast from the morningstar.
The saving throw DC for spells cast from the morningstar, as well as for creatures to avoid being {@condition 恐懼} by it, increases to 17.
When you use your reaction to deal psychic damage to a creature that hits you with a melee attack, the amount of psychic damage increases to {@dice 2d6}.

entries.name: Betrayer Artifact Properties
entries: The Arms of the Betrayers advance in power in the same manner as the Vestiges of Divergence. In its dormant state, each of these artifacts has one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and one {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property. When the artifact attains an awakened state, it gains an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property and an additional {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property. When the item reaches its exalted state, it gains a {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property. See "Artifact Properties" in chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for more information.

item.name: The Codicil of White
entries: The Codicil of White is a tall, thin volume bound in white ermine fur over seasoned boards of white pine and sealed with a clasp and lock of tarnished silver. The book is cold to the touch, and the fur is worn about the edges from use. The twenty-seven pages within are of vellum painted with silver gilt on the outer edges. The whole is sewn to a leather binding with strips of sinews, making it quite durable.
A creature with the codicil in its possession has resistance to cold damage.

The codicil was written by followers of Auril as a primer on her worship. The first page is a title page with the snowflake symbol of Auril on it. The remaining pages describe various priestly rituals and ceremonies in chilling detail. Nestled among these descriptions is a spell that wizards can learn ({@spell frost fingers|IDRotF}, and a poem called "Rime of the Frostmaiden" (see appendix E)). The poem is an incantation, the power of which can be used to split a glacier (see chapter 6). The poem might have other capabilities, at your discretion

item.name: The Incantations of Iriolarthas
entries: The Incantations of Iriolarthas is a weighty spellbook. Its black leather covers have dead, toothy worms glued to them, sheathed in glossy varnish. Set into this morbid display on the front cover is a gold rune that resembles a stylized eye with a pupil shaped like a candle flame—the sigil of Iriolarthas, a Netherese lich.
The book contains sixty pages of brittle yellow vellum. Written on these pages are the following wizard spells:

items: 1st level: {@spell 警報術}, {@spell 偵測魔法}, {@spell 鑑定術}, {@spell 魔法飛彈}, {@spell 護盾術}, {@spell 塔莎狂笑術}, {@spell 雷鳴波}
2nd level: {@spell 祕法鎖}, {@spell 不滅明焰}, {@spell 隱形術}, {@spell 敲擊術}, {@spell 浮空術}, {@spell 馬友夫強酸箭}, {@spell 鏡影術}
3rd level: {@spell 活化死屍}, {@spell 降咒}, {@spell 銳眼術}, {@spell 反制法術}, {@spell 解除魔法}, {@spell 火球術}, {@spell 守衛銘文}
4th level: {@spell 祕法眼}, {@spell 放逐術}, {@spell 枯萎術}, {@spell 次元門}, {@spell 艾伐黑觸手}, {@spell 魅影殺手}
5th level: {@spell 畢格比之掌}, {@spell 死雲術}, {@spell 支配人類}, {@spell 異界誓縛}, {@spell 探知}, {@spell 心靈遙控}
6th level: {@spell 創造不死生物}, {@spell 解離術}, {@spell 法術無效結界}, {@spell 地動術}, {@spell 奧圖狂舞術}
7th level: {@spell create magen|IDRotF}, {@spell 死亡一指}, {@spell 虹光噴射}, {@spell 傳送術}
8th level: {@spell 創造半位面}, {@spell 支配怪物}, {@spell 心靈屏障}, {@spell 律令震懾}
9th level: {@spell 災厄之刃|TCE}, {@spell 律令死亡}

item.name: The Infernal Machine of Lum the Mad
entries: This strange device was once thought to have been built by gods long forgotten and to have survived the eons since their passing, for it is incredibly ancient and crafted by means unlike anything known today. However, its true origins derive from a planar craft that crashed in the Barrier Peaks, for the Infernal Machine once functioned as this craft's central command console.

Explorers who discovered the crash site removed the command console and brought it back to civilization, not understanding its true purpose or powers. In later years, the console came into the possession of Baron Lum. By experimenting with its many controls, he was able to achieve astounding and destructive magical effects in the building of his empire, and so the artifact came to be known as the Infernal Machine of Lum the Mad. Yet with Lum's eventual defeat, his great machine was destroyed.

The Infernal Machine is a delicate, intricate, bulky, and heavy device, weighing some 5,500 pounds. It can be operated using a control panel containing sixty levers, forty dials, twenty switches, and a number of jeweled components. These controls generate all kinds of powers and effects, as noted below.

entries.name: Silver Wire
entries: The Infernal Machine's great size makes it largely immobile. To make ongoing use of the machine (such as while adventuring), it can be connected to its attuned user by a silver wire, a supply of which can always be produced from the machine's inner workings. This silver wire shares the same general nature as the silvery cord of an {@spell 星界投影} spell, connecting to the body of the user and trailing behind them. When so attached, the wire becomes {@condition 隱形}, astral, and extends to virtually infinite length.

As long as the wire remains intact, the attuned user can make full use of the Infernal Machine's powers, with their effects centered around the user. If the wire is cut—something that can happen only when an effect specifically states that it can cut an {@spell 星界投影}'s silvery cord—the user suffers a sudden burst of feedback from the machine that kills them instantly.

Any effect of the Infernal Machine that requires concentration can be concentrated on by a remote user. The Infernal Machine's effects have a spell save DC of 14 or the attuned user's spell save DC, whichever is higher.

entries.name: Summon Monster
entries: When first used by Baron Lum, the Infernal Machine was known for its ability to unleash terrible monsters within the world. Specific combinations of its controls can still recreate the effects of various spells of the conjuration school, as follows:

items: 1/day: {@spell 召喚動物}, {@spell summon lesser demons|XGE}
1/7 days: {@spell 召喚次級元素生物}, {@spell 召喚林地之精}, {@spell summon greater demon|XGE}
1/month: {@spell 召喚元素生物}, {@spell 召喚精類生物}

entries.name: Wish
entries: The Infernal Machine has the ability to bend the nature of reality, with the proper combination of controls recreating the effect of a {@spell 祈願術} spell (including all side effects). Due to the complex nature of its programming, this feature can be used only once per month. Each time this effect is used, there is a cumulative 10 percent chance of the Infernal Machine malfunctioning, necessitating seven days' worth of repairs and reprogramming, as well as the expenditure of 500 gp in parts, before it can be used again. When these repairs are done, the cumulative chance of malfunction returns to 10 percent.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: There are far more possible combinations for the Infernal Machine's controls than can ever be known or matrixed—especially as the controls shift position and reset themselves over time. At the end of each long rest of the user attuned to it, the Infernal Machine generates {@dice 1d4 + 1} random beneficial properties and {@dice 1d4 + 1} detrimental properties. Roll for each of these properties on the Infernal Machine Properties table. To keep things interesting, the DM might roll secretly for detrimental properties, revealing those properties only during the course of play.
Once set, these properties last until the end of the attuned user's next long rest.
(Our thanks to the D&D community for their suggestions for the properties of the Infernal Machine of Lum the Mad!)

entries.name: Destroying the Machine
entries: The Infernal Machine of Lum the Mad is self-repairing of anything short of catastrophic damage, and how it was disabled in Lum's time remains a mystery. It is rumored that if one specific combination of controls is set, the Infernal Machine will enter a repair mode, allowing unfettered access to its inner workings—and preventing it from restoring itself if it is attacked. Alternatively, other combinations of controls might cause the Infernal Machine to teleport its most critical components to some hiding place deep in space and time, rendering it inoperable until those components are found again.

entries.caption: Infernal Machine Properties
rows: You have a flying speed of 150 feet but lose all other movement.
You are {@condition 目盲}.
You can cast the {@spell 動物交談術} spell at will, but can use it to speak with only one animal of your choice.
All animals despise you. You have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill 馴獸}) checks.
One weapon or item you carry of your choice gains a walking speed of 30 feet and goes where you tell it.
Your armor and clothing feels unnaturally tight. Unless you go naked, roll a {@dice d4} each time you are attacked and subtract the number rolled from your AC.
You can cast the {@spell 通曉傳奇} spell three times.
Whenever you make an Intelligence check or use divination magic to learn something about a creature, that knowledge comes with added trivia of the DM's devising.
You emanate a weak magnetic aura. The first time during a combat that a creature attacks you with a metal weapon, that creature has disadvantage on the attack roll.
Metal rusts in response to your touch—including metal armor you wear and metal weapons you hold—reproducing the effect of the rust monster's Rust Metal trait.
Your fingers sprout tiny clockwork picks, granting you advantage on ability checks made using thieves' tools or tinker's tools.
Any metal object you wield or wear is covered in a thin layer of oil that drips occasionally and leaves your fingerprints everywhere.
You can cast the {@spell 動物交談術} spell at will, but can use it to communicate only with insects.
Disturbing whispers on the edge of hearing haunt all creatures within 30 feet of you, causing those creatures to recall their saddest memories.
You have a +1 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill 洞悉} checks) involving creatures you can see.
Your body is ghostly and translucent except for your bones. You have vulnerability to radiant damage, and you have disadvantage on attack rolls while in direct sunlight.
You summon a {@creature unicorn} that obeys your commands. If you give a command that violates the unicorn's allignment, the unicorn immediately vanishes.
You grow a unicorn horn.

A specialized clockwork compass floats in front of you. You can name one character, place, or object on the same plane as you and have the compass point constantly in the direction of the named target. You gain no knowledge of the distance to the target.

A specialized clockwork compass floats in front of you, and points toward you. The DM determines whether a creature currently looking for you is drawn to your location. Additionally, when a creature attacks you for the first time during an encounter, it has advantage on the attack roll.
Your clothes are wrapped in illusion that makes them appear to be the very latest style, drawing praise and attention. You have a +1 bonus to Charisma checks.
Any food and drink you eat spoils as you swallow it. Each time you eat or drink, you are {@condition 中毒} for 1 hour.
You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls with weapons or spells (your choice).
The {@spell 治療傷勢} spell restores no hit points for you.
You have an innate sense of direction. You automatically succeed on ability checks made to avoid becoming lost.
Whenever you move, a magical voice calls out your direction and how far you've gone. The voice cannot be silenced or stopped.
You constantly see afterimages of all events that occurred within 30 feet of you over the previous hour.
You are distracted by voices and visions, forcing you to succeed on a Wisdom saving throw every 4 hours or gain one level of {@condition 力竭}.
You understand all languages, as if under the effect of a {@spell 通曉語言} spell.
Whenever you speak, you speak in a random language (possibly including languages you don't normally know).
You have +1 bonus to initiative rolls.
You are unable to hear any speech louder than a whisper.
An exact duplicate of you appears next to you, dressed as you but lacking any gear. The duplicate functions as a familiar and has the statistics of a {@creature cat}.

An exact duplicate of you appears next to you, dressed as you but lacking any gear. It loudly tries to convince all other creatures that it is you, and you are its familiar. If destroyed, it reappears in {@dice 1d4} hours.

While you are afflicted by a disease or suffering the {@condition 中毒} or {@condition 恐懼} condition, whenever you hit a humanoid with a melee attack, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you transfer the disease or the condition to the target, and the disease or condition ends for you.

Water becomes intensely acidic to you. If you are submerged in water, you take {@dice 1d6} acid damage at the start of each of your turns, and drinking pure water causes you to be {@condition 中毒} for 1 hour.
A random Huge beast appears next to you (chosen by the DM) as if with the {@spell 召喚動物} spell. You have a telepathic link to this beast, such that you can give it commands even if it can't hear you.
A random Huge beast appears next to you (chosen by the DM) and attacks at once.
You have 1 luck point, which you can use as if you had taken the Lucky feat. If you have taken that feat, you have 1 extra luck point.
Those around you perceive you as dishonest, even when you are completely truthful. You automatically fail Charisma checks.

If you drop to 0 hit points, a phantom guardian appears next to you, functioning as if you had cast the {@spell 魔鄧肯忠犬} spell. The guardian disappears if you die, regain hit points, or regain consciousness.
No one takes you seriously, imposing disadvantage on Charisma ({@skill 欺瞞} and {@skill 說服}) checks, and causing you to automatically fail Charisma ({@skill 威嚇}) checks.
You can cast the {@spell 氣化形體} spell on yourself three times. When you do, instead of appearing as mist, you appear as a swirling puff of feathers.
Your body is covered in feathers.
You have advantage on death saving throws.
You have disadvantage on all saving throws except death saving throws.
You can cast {@spell 動物交談術} at will, but can use it to communicate only with dogs.
All cats are automatically hostile toward you.
You can cast the {@spell 喚醒死者} spell once, requiring no material components.
If you drop to 0 hit points, you automatically suffer 1 failed death saving throw.
Each time you finish a short rest, up to 100 silver pieces already in your possession become gold pieces, and up to 100 copper pieces become silver pieces.
All coins you touch become worthless tin.
Anything poisonous within 50 feet of you is automatically detected and marked by the image of a small frog that is visible only to you.
A dozen small frogs constantly follow you around, chirping loudly.
You gain the benefit of a {@spell 迴避偵測} spell.
Your appearance changes randomly as determined by the DM, as if you were under the effect of a disguise self spell.
You can cast the {@spell 法師之手} cantrip at will.
A disembodied spirit follows you around, stealing and scattering coins from you, crumbling your food, and playing with your weapons and gear.
You are able to decipher any text.
You lose the ability to speak any language. This has no effect on casting spells with verbal components.
You can cast the {@spell 植物交談術} spell three times.
Your skin turns green, and you must drink a half gallon of fresh water every 4 hours or take {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage.
You know whether creatures within 15 feet of you are lying, as if you were the center of a {@spell 誠實之域} spell.
Whenever you would speak falsely, you cannot speak at all.
You gain a sense of destiny that directs you toward an important goal, as determined by the DM.
Your head is filled with an unpleasant buzzing that imposes disadvantage on Intelligence checks and saving throws.

All creatures you speak with automatically believe your words, as if you have succeeded on a Charisma ({@skill 欺瞞} or {@skill 說服}) check against them. Any sign of threatening or duplicitous action on your part negates this automatic success.
Your personal tastes reverse, such that your favorite foods, hobbies, music, and so forth become unbearable to you.
Your shadow becomes an undead {@creature shadow} that shares your alignment and is under your control.
Your shadow behaves disapprovingly whenever you're not looking—stealing things, mocking you behind your back, taunting opponents or friends, and so on.
Your skin is covered by slime. You automatically succeed on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.
Your skin is covered by slime. You must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw to sit down, open doors, and perform other mundane tasks of the DM's determination.
Flowers turn to face you as you pass them.
Mundane animals can't look at you.

Each time you finish a short rest, you suddenly sprout a covering of fragrant leaves. The leaves fall off after {@dice 1d10} minutes, revealing {@dice 1d6} magic fruits that can be plucked from your head. Each fruit functions as a berry created with the {@spell 神莓術} spell.
Whenever you stop moving for 10 minutes or more, you discover that your boots or shoes have set down roots that must be pulled free with a successful DC 20 Strength check.
Choose a creature you can see. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or drop one item they are holding (DM's choice). You can use this property three times.
Each time you roll a 1 on a Dexterity check, you drop one object you are holding (DM's choice).
A group of small forest animals appears and follows you everywhere, singing and dancing. These magical creatures can perform any task you desire that could be performed by a {@spell 魔法技倆} spell.
You break out into song whenever you roll a 1 on any die.

Your possessions change their state or appearance at the DM's determination, giving you hints of potential future events. For example, your sword might become suddenly bloodstained to warn of an upcoming combat encounter, your clothes might become damp to warn of a water-filled pit trap ahead, and so on.
You take a −5 penalty to initiative rolls.
Whenever you roll a 1 on a {@dice d20}, you have advantage on your next {@dice d20} roll.
Whenever you roll a 1 on a {@dice d20}, you have disadvantage on your next {@dice d20} roll.
Grass, moss, and flowers instantly grow in your footsteps. You are also unaffected by difficult terrain created by plants.
Any harm that befalls a plant you can see (a woodcutter sawing down a tree, a gardener pulling weeds, and so forth) fills you with a sadness that imposes disadvantage on ability checks for 1 minute.
You automatically know the direction to the greatest danger within 500 feet of you.
You leave a trail of black footprints that allow anyone to automatically follow you.
You can cast the {@spell 偵測思想} spell three times.
All creatures within 30 feet of you automatically know your surface thoughts, as if having cast {@spell 偵測思想} against you.
You can cast the {@spell 迷蹤步} spell three times. When you do, you must begin and end your teleportation in an area of shadow.
While in direct sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls as well as on Wisdom ({@skill 察覺}) checks that rely on sight.
Creatures cannot gain advantage on attacks made against you as a result of another creature using the {@action 協助} action.
You have disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill 體操}) checks.
You have increased lung capacity, increasing your walking speed by 10 feet and letting you hold your breath for twice as long as normal.
Whenever you exert yourself by fighting, running, and so forth, you breathe out intermittent gouts of flame that deal {@dice 1d4} fire damage to you.
You can cast the {@spell 晝明術} spell three times.
An evil undead creature that comes within 30 feet of you for the first time is {@condition 魅惑} by you until the end of your next turn.
When you touch a copper piece, it transmutes to become two copper pieces. You can duplicate a maximum of 1,000 coins this way.
Food doesn't satiate you, and you must eat double the amount of food you normally eat to avoid feeling hungry.
You shed light like a torch, as if you were the target of a {@spell 光亮術} cantrip.
No one else can take a short rest within 40 feet of you, as everything you say or do seems distracting to them.
You can cast the {@spell 預言術} spell once.
Whenever you make an Intelligence check or saving throw, you receive a grim vision of the DM's determination, imposing disadvantage on your next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

As an action, you can become incorporeal for 10 minutes, allowing you to move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 ({@dice 1d10}) force damage if you end your turn inside an object. You can use this property once.
Your senses diminish as if the world were faded around you, imposing disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill 察覺}) checks.
While you take a short rest, the area within 50 feet of you takes on the illusory appearance of a beautiful forest glade.
The first time an ally you can see takes damage as a result of failing a saving throw, you take the damage instead of them.
As a bonus action, you can choose one creature within 10 feet of you and know one secret about it, as determined by the DM.
The {@spell 移除詛咒}, {@spell 次級復原術}, and {@spell 高等復原術} spells have no effect on you.
You can predict the weather conditions for the next 24 hours with perfect accuracy.
A rain cloud follows you around, drizzling on you constantly even while indoors.
You have telepathy out to a range of 120 feet.
You hear the voices of creatures you can see in your head from time to time (as detailed by the DM), but you have no idea whether what you're hearing is the truth or not.
You can cast {@spell 動物交談術} at will, but you can use it to communicate only with goats. Any goat you speak with becomes {@condition 魅惑} by you for 1 hour.
You become distraught unless your clothing is all the same color, imposing disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks and saving throws.
You have resistance to fire damage.
You gain no benefit from any potion.
You have immunity to the {@condition 魅惑} and {@condition 恐懼} conditions.
You can speak only in a monotone voice, imposing disadvantage on Charisma checks.
You and each creature within 10 feet of you have resistance to necrotic damage.
Any Wisdom ({@skill 醫療}) check you make or that is made to help you is made with disadvantage.
The first creature you hit with a weapon attack on each of your turns takes {@dice 1d4} fire damage at the start of its next turn.
You are {@condition 目盲} while in bright light, and your shadow takes on a monstrous appearance.
No creature can learn your alignment by magical means, and you have advantage on Charisma checks involving creatures that also share your alignment.
You have disadvantage on Charisma checks involving creatures that do not share your alignment.
As a bonus action, you cause yourself and a willing ally you can see to swap positions by teleportation.
Whenever you roll a 1 on a {@dice d20} roll, you and an ally you can see swap positions by teleportation.
As an action, you cause difficult terrain within 50 feet of you to become normal terrain. You can use this property three times.
Each time you move through difficult terrain, your speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.
You increase one ability score of your choice by 2. You can increase an ability score above 20 using this property, but the increase is lost when this property ends.
Whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw using your highest ability score, you take {@dice 1d4} psychic damage.
As an action, you learn the direction and distance to the nearest magic item not in the possession of you or any of your allies.
Each creature within 30 feet of you automatically knows which magic items you carry.

As an action while you are in dim light or darkness, you can become {@condition 隱形}, as if targeted by the {@spell 隱形術} spell. In addition to becoming visible if you attack or cast a spell, you become visible if you move into bright light. You can use this property three times.
While in bright light, you have disadvantage on initiative rolls.
You can read and understand all the languages commonly spoken within 1 mile of you, as determined by the DM.
While speaking, you occasionally use nonsense words, imposing disadvantage on Charisma checks.
You know one cantrip of the DM's choice, and can cast one 1st-level spell of the DM's choice at will.

Whenever you cast a spell or use a magic item property that requires an action or a bonus action to activate, roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table (see the sorcerer section in chapter 3 of the Player's Handbook) to see what happens.
Whenever you roll a 20 on a {@dice d20}, you can immediately end one effect on you.
Whenever you roll a 1 on a {@dice d20}, you are {@condition 目盲} until the end of your next turn.

Any clothing you wear is covered with a magical map image that shows all the local area you are aware of. This map doesn't reveal anything you don't know, but grants advantage on ability checks to find secret doors and to navigate back to where you've been.
Any rope you touch transforms into a {@creature poisonous snake} that attacks you.
You summon a {@creature slithering tracker|VGM} that obeys your commands.
You take on the appearance of having translucent skin, with your bones and organs slightly visible within.
You have a fresh-scrubbed appearance, and a sweet perfume surrounds you. You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill 說服}) checks.
Whenever you fail a Charisma ({@skill 說服}) check, the subject of the check becomes irrationally resentful of you, seeking to undermine you in ways determined by the DM.
You can cast the control weather spell.

Each time you deal or take cold damage or fire damage, you must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or accidentally summon a hostile {@creature air elemental} or {@creature fire elemental} (depending on the damage dealt).
A tiny construct resembling a {@creature gynosphinx} follows you around. It can truthfully answer up to ten yes-or-no questions regarding the campaign, at the DM's discretion.
A tiny construct resembling a {@creature gynosphinx} follows you around. It constantly asks unsolvable riddles of other creatures, and insults those creatures when they fail to answer correctly.

A creature appears next to you that is a hybrid of any two nonmagical beasts (akin to the {@creature owlbear}). The creature serves you as if created by a {@spell 召喚動物} spell. The DM determines the creature's statistics.

A creature appears next to you that is a hybrid of any two nonmagical beasts (akin to the {@creature owlbear}). Unless you succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom ({@skill 馴獸}) check, the creature attacks you before wandering off. The DM determines the creature's statistics.
You can cast the {@spell 傳送術} spell, always arriving on target when you do. You can use this property once.

Each time you walk through a doorway or similar portal, you must succeed on a DC 10 Intelligence check or step into a skewed timeline. On a failure, you and all allies within 10 feet of you skip ahead {@dice 1d4} minutes. To other creatures, it appears that you and other affected creatures disappear for that length of time, then appear again in the doorway.
You can cast the {@spell 加速術} spell on yourself. You can use this property three times.
Each time you are reduced to 0 hit points then stabilized, you suffer the effect of a {@spell 緩速術} spell.
You do not need to breathe and cease to do so, making you immune to inhaled poisons and suffocation.
Whenever you speak (including casting a spell with a verbal component), you must first use a bonus action to breathe.
Your blood is venomous, granting you immunity to poison and to the {@condition 中毒} condition. You can cast the {@spell 動物交談術} spell at will, but you can use it to communicate only with snakes.

Your tongue is long and forked, causing you to speak in a hiss. You have disadvantage on Charisma checks involving speech, and you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution check to cast a spell with a verbal component.

You grow gills and have the ability to breathe air and water. You also sprout a pair of tentacles from your shoulders that have a reach of 10 feet and can be used to perform any action you could perform with your hands. The tentacles cannot attack or grapple.

You are constantly followed by {@dice 1d4} {@creature octopus||octopuses} that can breathe air and water, and which have a walking speed of 30 feet. Each time combat breaks out, you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom ({@skill 馴獸}) check or have the octopuses panic and attack you.

You can cast the {@spell 迷蹤步} spell three times. When you do, you must begin and end your teleportation in an area of fire. Any fire damage you take during the same turn in which you use {@spell 迷蹤步} is restored automatically at the end of your turn.
Whenever you start your turn within 30 feet of an ongoing fire effect, you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or move toward the fire and into it if possible.
When you look at the sky, you see it overlaid with navigational symbols. You have advantage on ability checks made to avoid becoming lost while outdoors.
You have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill 察覺}) checks while indoors.
You can cast the {@spell 治癒真言} spell three times.
Undead are drawn to you, making it impossible for you to hide from them. Each undead creature you face in combat has advantage on its first attack roll against you.
Any food you touch is transformed into a culinary delight. You have advantage on Charisma checks while interacting with any creatures that have eaten of this food.
You constantly hear distracting music that throws off your timing, imposing disadvantage on initiative rolls and Dexterity checks.
Your mind is filled with lost facts and lore, granting advantage on Intelligence checks.
You forget your name, and must be constantly reminded of it by your allies.
Your touch can change small nonmagical objects into chocolate.
Anything you eat or drink makes you feel overly sated and full, imposing disadvantage on Strength checks for 1 hour.
Each time you finish a short rest, you regain {@dice 1d8} hit points. Each creature that took a short rest with you and remained within 30 feet of you for the duration also gains this benefit.

Each time you finish a short rest, you take {@dice 3d8} psychic damage. At your determination, you can transfer some or all of this damage to any creatures that took a short rest with you and remained within 30 feet of you for the duration.
Each time you finish a short rest, you find {@dice 1d10} small gems worth 10 gp each in your possession.
Whenever you spend coins or gems, any character you give them to becomes convinced that the wealth was stolen from them.
When you hit a creature for the first time during an encounter, its Armor Class is reduced by 1.
Whenever you roll a 1 on a weapon attack roll, the weapon shatters like glass. The weapon magically reforms in {@dice 1d4} rounds.
Each time you enter a settlement, you are treated as though you are known there and a friend, even if you are neither.
Each time you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you grow one inch taller. Your clothing and armor does not grow with you.
While standing in a doorway, you can cast the {@spell 傳送術} spell. Your destination must be another doorway you know. You can use this property once.
Each time you finish a short rest, you forget one of your allies (of the DM's choice) and no longer trust that character. You lose this distrust at the end of your next short rest.

As an action, you cause a swirling storm of rocks and dust to surround you in a 10-foot radius for 1 minute. Each creature hostile to you that enters the area must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and be {@condition 目盲} for 1 round. You can use this property three times.

{@creature fire elemental||Fire elementals}, {@creature water elemental||water elementals}, and other creatures of fire and water (as determined by the DM) regard you as their enemy, and focus their attacks against you to the exclusion of all else.
As an action, you learn the names of every humanoid creature within 30 feet of you.
Whenever you roll a 1 on a Strength or Dexterity check that incorporates touching an object, you stick to that object for 1 minute. It takes a successful DC 20 Strength check to free yourself.
You can cast the {@spell 修改記憶} spell once.
Whenever you make an Intelligence check or saving throw, you must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or lose all your memories of the past hour.
You can ignore the verbal component of any spell you cast.
You must shout the verbal component of any spell you cast.
As an action, you conjure a mindless, shapeless force that is your exact duplicate. You control this force as if it were the product of an {@spell 隱形僕役} spell, except that it is visible.

Each time you see your own reflection, you must succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, you treat your allies as enemies and vice versa for 1 minute, attacking the wrong targets, betraying your companions in social situations, and so forth. You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.
As an action, you can replace one of your hands with any nonmagical weapon, tool, or piece of adventuring equipment of reasonable size (as determined by the DM).

Your hands feel unnaturally large, imposing disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill 巧手}) checks and Dexterity checks using thieves' tools or artisan's tools. The first weapon attack roll you make in any encounter is made with disadvantage.
All creatures of a particular type other than humanoid (as chosen by the DM) are incapable of acting hostile toward you as long as you do not attack, threaten, or provoke them.

Whenever you meet a creature of a particular type other than humanoid (as chosen by the DM), there is a 1 percent cumulative chance that the {@creature tarrasque} is magically summoned within 1 mile of you. The tarrasque has no knowledge of your existence. It runs amok for {@dice 1d6 × 10} minutes, then magically returns to its previous location.

item.name: Theki Root
entries: This thick marsh root tastes bitter but is thought to aid digestive health. When you use an action to consume a dose, you gain advantage on saving throws against the effects of poisonous or toxic substances for 8 hours.

item.name: Thelarr
entries: Also known as a whistlecane, a simple and easy-to-make wind instrument cut from a reed. They are so simple, in fact, that skilled bards frequently make and give them away to children—to the parents' delight or regret.

item.name: Thermal Cube
entries: This 3-inch cube of solid brimstone generates enough dry heat to keep the temperature within 15 feet of it at 95 degrees Fahrenheit (35 degrees Celsius).

item.name: Thessaltoxin
entries: This poison was first created using blood harvested from the artificer Thessalar. A creature subjected to the poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take on a new form as if affected by the {@spell 變形術} spell. The creature's new form is a random beast or a creature it has seen within the last 24 hours (as chosen by the DM). This transformation lasts until the end of the target's next long rest. This effect is not subject to {@spell 解除魔法} or {@spell 移除詛咒}, but a {@spell 高等復原術} spell restores the creature to its original form.

item.name: Thessaltoxin Antidote
entries: This potion appears to change color and texture each time you look at it. When you drink the potion, it ends the {@spell 變形術} effect imposed by thessaltoxin.

item.name: 盜賊工具
entries: 這一組工具包括了一把小銼刀、一套開鎖工具、一面附有鐵柄的小鏡、一組窄刃剪刀、以及一對鉗子。熟練於這套工具組能讓你將你的熟練加值加到任何你在爲了解除陷阱或開鎖時所進行的屬性檢定中。
additionalEntries: 專用於撬鎖和解除陷阱的盜賊工具，也許是冒險者們最常用的工具了。熟練掌握這些工具還可以瞭解陷阱和鎖的基本知識。

additionalEntries.name: 組件
entries: 盜賊工具包括一把小銼刀、一套開鎖器、一面安裝在金屬柄上的小鏡子、一把窄刃剪刀和一把鑷子。

additionalEntries.name: 歷史
entries: 你對陷阱的知識能讓你在回答關於以陷阱出名的名勝的問題具有額外的洞察力。

additionalEntries.name: 調查、察覺
entries: 你在搜索陷阱時具有額外的洞察力，因爲你已熟知各類陷阱的外在跡象。

additionalEntries.name: 設置陷阱
entries: 如同你可以解除陷阱一樣，你也可以設置陷阱。你可以在短休中使用手頭上的物品製造陷阱。你進行一次檢定，檢定的最終結果將作爲他人發現或解除該陷阱的DC值。陷阱造成的傷害值取決於製造它所用的材料（例如毒藥或武器），或等同於你檢定結果的一半，這將由DM決定。

additionalEntries.caption: 盜賊工具
rows: 撬鎖
可變
解除陷阱
可變

item.name: 三龍牌套組
entries: （譯註：威世智於2005年出版的紙牌遊戲，參見{@link 三龍牌|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three-Dragon_Ante}。）

item.name: 雷鳴吸收刺青
entries: {#itemEntry 吸收刺青|TCE}

item.name: 虎眼石
entries: 棕中帶金的透光寶石。

item.name: Timepiece of Travel
entries: While attuned to this device, you have a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws and you always know which way is north. Additionally, you can cast the longstrider spell on yourself at will.

entries.name: Turn-by-Turn Directions
entries: You can name any location within 10 miles of your current location that is known to at least one creature also within 10 miles of that location (including you). Once you name the location, a disembodied voice heard only by you provides directions to the location by the safest, most direct route. The voice knows to avoid natural hazards, so that it does not send you through trackless wilderness or into a lake. But it has no knowledge of or ability to help you avoid monsters, enemies, traps, locked doors, and the like.

The timepiece is of no use for reaching locations that are wholly secret or not known to any creatures within range. Once you use this feature of the timepiece of travel, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Get Away From It All
entries: As an action, you can cast the {@spell 傳送術} spell. Once you use this feature of the timepiece of travel, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Part of a Whole
entries: While this component is not installed in the {@item Orrery of the Wanderer|AI}, its magic might function sporadically or with unpredictable side effects, as determined by the DM.

item.name: 打火匣
entries: 這個小容器內含了燧石、打火鐵、和火種（通常爲浸泡過燈油的乾布料）用以生火。用其來點亮火炬 ─ 或其它有着充沛、外露燃料的東西 ─ 需要一個動作。點亮其它火苗則需要1分鐘。

item.name: 焰襲
entries: 作爲一把燧石匕首，焰襲有着極爲奇特的形狀，它的刀刃異常鋒利，且當它擊中堅硬的物體時，它的邊緣就會迸發出火花。它的刀柄摸上去總是很溫暖，刀刃在使用後會悶燒{@dice 1d4}分鐘。它內部蘊含着邪惡的火元素親王{@creature Imix|PotA|伊密克斯}的碎片。
你在使用這把武器進行的攻擊檢定和傷害骰上具有+2加值。當你用它造成傷害時，目標將會額外受到{@dice 2d6}火焰傷害。

entries.name: 火元素掌控
entries: 當你持握焰襲時，你獲得以下好處：

items: 你可以流利地使用火族語。
你對火焰傷害具有抗性。
你可以對{@creature 火元素}施放{@spell 支配怪物}(DC 17)。一旦你這麼做，焰襲的這個能力直到下次日出前都無法再被使用。

entries.name: 焚世烈焰之舞
entries: 當位於一個火元素節點內時，你可以施展一個名爲「焚世烈焰之舞」的儀式，使用焰襲製造一個{@item 毀滅法球(火)|PotA}。一旦你運行了這個儀式，焰襲直到下次日出前都不能再被用於施展這個儀式。

entries.name: 缺陷
entries: 焰襲會讓持用者變得急躁和魯莽。當你與該武器同調時，你獲得以下缺陷：「我做事不加思考，冒險不考慮後果。」

item.name: 修理工具
additionalEntries: 修補工具用於修復各種普通物件。雖然你不能用修補工具製造很多東西，但你可以縫補衣服、磨礪鋒刃，或是修補好破掉的鍊甲。

additionalEntries.name: 組件
entries: 修補工具包括各種手工用品、針線、磨刀石、一些零碎的布料和皮料，以及一小壺膠。

additionalEntries.name: 歷史
entries: 你可以確定物件的年齡和來歷，即使你只剩下幾塊原件的碎片。

additionalEntries.name: 調查
entries: 當你檢查一個損壞的物件時，你能推測出損壞的原因及時間。

additionalEntries.name: 修復
entries: 你每花費1個小時的工作時間，就能爲一件損壞的物件恢復10點生命值。你必須具有與之對應的修補材料。對於金屬製品，你還需要具備一處足以使金屬熱塑變形的明火。

additionalEntries.caption: 修補工具
rows: 臨時修復一件報廢設備
僅用一半時間修補物品
利用廢料製造臨時物品

item.name: Tocken
entries: A hanging set of carved oval bells, usually played with a pair of light wooden hammers (or open handed). They are most common in underground cultures, where the resonant tones can carry.

item.name: 清澈思想卷冊
entries: 這本書記載着關於記憶力和邏輯的鍛鍊訣竅，且它的文本充滿着魔力。若你在6天或更短的期間內花費了總共48小時的時間研讀這本書的內容，並實踐它的指示，則你的智力值和智力值上限都將增加2點。這本手冊接着將失去它的魔力，並在一個世紀之後恢復。

item.name: 統御影響卷冊
entries: 這本書記載着關於影響力和吸引他人的訣竅，且它的文本充滿着魔力。若你在6天或更短的期間內花費了總共48小時的時間研讀這本書的內容，並實踐它的指示，則你的魅力值和魅力值上限都將增加2點。這本手冊接着將失去它的魔力，並在一個世紀之後恢復。

item.name: Tome of Strahd
entries: The Tome of Strahd is an ancient work penned by Strahd, a tragic tale of how he came to his fallen state. The book is bound in a thick leather cover with steel hinges and fastenings. The pages are of parchment and very brittle. Most of the book is written in the curious shorthand that only Strahd employs. Stains and age have made most of the work illegible, but several paragraphs remain intact.

item.name: 靜語卷冊
entries: 這本以厚重皮革包覆的卷冊在封面上釘着一條風乾的舌頭。這種卷冊共有五冊存在，且沒有人知道哪一本纔是原版。第一本靜語卷冊那裝飾着可怕封面的舌頭，曾經屬於一名背叛了巫妖之神，守密者維克那的僕人。而釘在另外四本複製品封面上的舌頭則來自於其他冒犯了維克那的施法者。每本卷冊的前幾頁都寫滿了無法解讀的潦草字跡，而剩餘的書頁則潔白如新。
若你可以與這個物品同調，則你可以使用它作爲一本法術書和一件奧術法器。此外，當持握這本卷冊時，你可以使用一個附贈動作以施放一個你已經寫在這本卷冊上的法術，且無須消耗法術位或使用任何聲音或姿勢構材。一旦被使用，這本卷冊的此特性直到下次日出前都不能再被使用。
當與這本卷冊同調時，你可以將其舌頭從這本書的封面移除。若你這麼做，則所有被寫在書中的法術都將被永久抹消。
維克那留意着任何使用這本卷冊的人。祂也可以在這本書上寫下加密過的消息。這些消息將在午夜出現，並在它們被閱讀之後消失不見。

item.name: 通曉卷冊
entries: 這本書記載着關於直覺和洞察力的鍛鍊訣竅，且它的文本充滿着魔力。若你在6天或更短的期間內花費了總共48小時的時間研讀這本書的內容，並實踐它的指示，則你的感知值和感知值上限都將增加2點。這本手冊接着將失去它的魔力，並在一個世紀之後恢復。

item.name: 黃玉
entries: 金黃色的透光寶石。

item.name: 火炬
entries: 一支火炬可以燃燒1小時，提供20尺半徑的明亮光照和再延伸20尺的微光光照。如果你使用燃燒中的火炬進行一次近戰攻擊，它會造成1火焰傷害。

item.name: 蒙汗藥
entries: 受害於這種毒藥的生物必須成功通過一次DC 15的體質豁免，否則陷入{@condition 中毒}狀態長達{@dice 4d6}個小時。陷入{@condition 中毒}狀態的生物同時也將陷入{@condition 無力}狀態。

item.name: 電氣石
entries: 淡綠色、藍色、褐色、或紅色的透光寶石。

item.name: Travel Alchemical Kit
entries: Also at rank 3, Head Office provides you with a travel alchemical kit—an uncommon magic item containing miniaturized versions of both {@item 鍊金工具|phb} and a {@item 製毒工具|phb} (glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod). You gain proficiency with a {@item 製毒工具|phb} as part of this upgrade.

You can use this magical kit as long as it is on your person, with no need to draw or stow it. If you are ever searched, finding your travel alchemical kit requires a successful DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill 調查}) or Wisdom ({@skill 洞悉}) check.

item.name: Treasure chest crafted of exotic wood with gold fittings and opals (Brazen Coalition)
Treebane
entries: The axe's handle is carved with leaves and vines, and it weighs half as much as a normal battleaxe. When the axe hits a plant, whether an ordinary plant or a plant creature, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d8} slashing damage. When a creature of non-good alignment wields the axe, it sprouts thorns whenever its wielder makes an attack with it. These thorns prick the wielder for 1 piercing damage after the attack is made, and this damage is considered magical.

item.name: 命令魚類三叉戟
entries: 這個三叉戟是一把魔法武器。它含有3發充能。當你攜帶它時，你可以使用一個動作以消耗1發充能，並從它對一個具有天生游泳速度的野獸施放{@spell 支配野獸}法術（豁免DC 15）。這把三叉戟會在每天日出時恢復{@dice 1d3}發已消耗的充能。

item.name: Trinket
entries: Worried that you're going to pull out your dead sprite inside a clear glass bottle at a company function only to discover that three other people in the franchise have one as well? Then consider rolling on the Acquisitions Incorporated Trinkets table instead of the {@item Trinket|phb|table in chapter 5 of the Player's Handbook}, to gain a unique trinket at character creation with a bit of Acq Inc flair.

item.name: Trinket
entries: When you make your character, you can roll once on the Trinkets table to gain a trinket, a simple item lightly touched by mystery. The DM might also use this table. It can help stock a room in a dungeon or fill a creatures pockets.

entries.caption: Curse of Strahd. Character Options, Gothic Trinket Table
rows: A picture you drew as a child of your imaginary friend
A lock that opens when blood is dripped in its keyhole
Clothes stolen from a {@creature scarecrow}
A spinning top carved with four faces: happy, sad, wrathful, and dead

A small mirror that shows a much older version of the viewer

A mummified raven claw

An old little doll made from a dark, dense wood and missing a hand and a foot

item.name: Trinket
entries: When you make your character, you can roll once on the Trinkets table to gain a trinket, a simple item lightly touched by mystery. The DM might also use this table. It can help stock a room in a dungeon or fill a creatures pockets.

entries.caption: Elemental Evil Trinket Table
rows: A compass that always points to Mulmaster

A glass eyeball that looks about of its own accordance, and can roll around
A glass orb that replicates yesterday's weather inside itself
A drinking cup, that randomly fills with fresh or salt water. Refilling once emptied
A deep blue piece of flint, that when struck with steel produces not a spark but a drop of water
A conch shell which is always damp and constantly drips saltwater
A charred, half-melted pewter clasp that glows as if smoldering but releases no heat

An unbreakable sealed jar of glowing water that hums when shaken
A small, finely polished geode whose crystals slowly fade between every color of the spectrum
